client

Class ServerAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.ServerAccess
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockServerAccess

    public class ServerAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for all communication to/from server.

    To communicate with a remote server, construct a ServerAccess object (using the default port or one of your own specification) and invoke the connect(IMessageHandler) method. Once connected, you can send a message request to the server through the sendRequest(Message) message. All responses to these requests from the server are processed by a IMessageHandler object.

    Should you want more control, then when sending a request, you can also register a IController object to specifically be given the response from the server to a given request.

    Once done, call disconnect() and the server communication will be terminated and the background ServerThread thread will cleanly shut down.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect(IMessageHandler handler)
        Start up reader and talker threads. Returns false if unable to contact server. When server messages are received, they are handled by the given handler object.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Request to disconnect from server (internal or external).

      • sendRequest

        public boolean sendRequest(Message r)
        Send request to the server. Return success or failure

      • sendRequest

        public boolean sendRequest(IController c,
                           Message m)
        Send request to the server and register controller to process response only on success. Return success or failure of operation.

        The given IController object is going to be responsible for processing the response that comes back.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Useful method for extracting key information in error messages.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • isWaiting

        public boolean isWaiting()
        Determines whether there are any controllers waiting on a response.

      • getHost

        public java.lang.String getHost()
        Utility method to return host to which ServerAccess connected.
